head.title: Staten Island: Arrest In Commune Leader's Shooting

hedline.hl1: Staten Island: Arrest In Commune Leader's Shooting
hedline.hl2: Staten Island: Arrest in Commune Leader’s Shooting

block.p: A woman sought for more than a year in the shooting of a Staten Island commune leader was arrested yesterday after getting off a train in Philadelphia, federal marshals said. The woman, Rebekah Johnson, has been charged with attempted murder in the shooting of the commune leader, Jeff Gross, who helped found the Ganas community. Ms. Johnson, 44, is accused of jumping from bushes at Mr. Gross's home in May 2006 and shooting him in the chest and arm.
